content:
In this PR, I've shown that with appropriate assumptions on rings R and S, being a RingHomClass from R to S is the same thing as being a Language.ring.StrongHomClass. However, making both of these implications into instances makes a loop.

I'd like some advice on which direction is the better instance to keep, particularly as this API style should be replicated for other languages.
For a bit more context as to why these instances could be useful, see #16107, #16108, and #16008.
Lean 4 is "supposed" to handle looping instances (in quotation marks since there is evidence that some issues persist). Do you have any evidence that the loop you're introducing is problematic?
If there is such evidence, then I would suggest making two locales ToModelTheory/OfModelTheory (up to debate) in which all the instances going to/from HomClass and StrongHomClass are localized
Sorry, I should have read the PR before speaking. You say there that it is problematic
To be specific, it was causing a problem in test/TCSynth.lean.
You could make it a scoped instance. That's what I did to avoid the heartbeat problem in that test file.
